trans-unit.source: Send messages to Event Hubs
trans-unit.target: Send messages to Event Hubs

trans-unit.source: In this section we will write a Java console app to send events to your Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: In this section we will write a Java console app to send events to your Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: We will make use of the JMS AMQP provider from the <link><linkText>Apache Qpid project</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: We will make use of the JMS AMQP provider from the <link><linkText>Apache Qpid project</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This is analogous to using Service Bus queues and topics with AMQP through Java as shown <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This is analogous to using Service Bus queues and topics with AMQP through Java as shown <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For more information, refer to <link><linkText>Qpid JMS documentation</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Java Messaging Service</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, refer to <link><linkText>Qpid JMS documentation</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Java Messaging Service</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In Eclipse, install the <link><linkText>Azure Toolkit for Eclipse</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: In Eclipse, install the <link><linkText>Azure Toolkit for Eclipse</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This includes the Qpid JMS AMQP client libraries.
trans-unit.target: This includes the Qpid JMS AMQP client libraries.

trans-unit.source: In Eclipse, create a new Java project named Sender.
trans-unit.target: In Eclipse, create a new Java project named Sender.

trans-unit.source: In Eclipse Package Explorer, right-click the Sender project and select Properties.
trans-unit.target: In Eclipse Package Explorer, right-click the Sender project and select Properties.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane of the dialog, click Java Build Path, then click the Libraries tab, and then the Add Library button.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane of the dialog, click Java Build Path, then click the Libraries tab, and then the Add Library button.

trans-unit.source: Select Package for Apache Qpid Client Libraries for JMS (by MS Open Tech), click Next, and then click Finish.
trans-unit.target: Select Package for Apache Qpid Client Libraries for JMS (by MS Open Tech), click Next, and then click Finish.

trans-unit.source: Create a file named servicebus.properties in the root of the Sender project, with the following content.
trans-unit.target: Create a file named servicebus.properties in the root of the Sender project, with the following content.

trans-unit.source: Remember to substitute the values of your:
trans-unit.target: Remember to substitute the values of your:

trans-unit.source: Event Hub name.
trans-unit.target: Event Hub name.

trans-unit.source: namespace name (the latter is usually {event hub name}-ns).
trans-unit.target: namespace name (the latter is usually {event hub name}-ns).

trans-unit.source: URL-encoded SendRule key (you made a note of this key when you created your Event Hub).
trans-unit.target: URL-encoded SendRule key (you made a note of this key when you created your Event Hub).

trans-unit.source: You can URL-encode it <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can URL-encode it <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Create a new class named Sender.
trans-unit.target: Create a new class named Sender.

trans-unit.target: Add the following import statements:
